result.execSummary:
The defendant Alphonso Michael Givens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 7/18/2017. Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment subject to tax intercept to be entered. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
Consecutive to: consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 41 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alphonso Michael Givens

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alphonso Michael Givens in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court sentences defendant to serve 41 days  in the House of Correction consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 41 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court Orders defendant to: 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 7/18/2017. Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment subject to tax intercept to be entered. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 


Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 7/15/2016, received and filed.
JusticePoint Violation Report dated 7/12/2016, received and filed. Court will address at next court date.

Defendant Alphonso Michael Givens in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: AMI 
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 6/29/2016, received and filed.

Attorney James Robert Daniel Rael in court, defendant Alphonso Michael Givens not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for return on doctors report. Doctors report not available for today's proceedings. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Defense counsel requests that the remand be lifted. State does not object. Court orders that the remand be canceled.   

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping. 

Court reminded defendant to have no contact with any Pick N Save stores. 

  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alphonso Michael Givens in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing. 

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James Robert Daniel Rael in court, defendant Alphonso Michael Givens not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defendant not produced for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 21.

Attorney James Robert Daniel Rael in court, defendant Alphonso Michael Givens not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defendant not produced for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney James Robert Daniel Rael in court, Defendant Alphonso Michael Givens not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from MSDF for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James Robert Daniel Rael in court, defendant Alphonso Michael Givens not in court, in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defendant not produced for today's proceedings. Defense counsel requests an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 4. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alphonso Michael Givens in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Pick n Save Store

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Alphonso Michael Givens in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Alphonso Michael Givens in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Havas, Br. 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
